resources.string: General information and recommendations for new exchange students

There is a public transport card which is called Móbilis: The Móbilis Card (Tarjeta Móbilis) is a unique personalised card which you can use for the metro, bus and valenbisi. In other words: it\'s the only rechargeable card for all public transport in Valencia. You can buy a Móbilis Card at the tobacconists, newsagents and metro stations (but not at a ticket machine!).\nOn this card you can charge your metro and bus rides. If you charge the Mobilis Card with several rides at once using the Bonobus and Bonometro package you can save money.\nYou can see all the information here

A new urban transport concept the individual bike. An ecological and healthy option, available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. More and more cities are offering their citizens the opportunity to get around by bike. Valenbisi is available to both residents and visitors with 2,750 bikes across 275 stations, located all over the city.\nIf you pay a yearly subscription (which costs less than 30€) you can use the bikes for 30 minutes at a time whenever you want, any time, any day (the trick is to change your bike every 25 minutes so that you don\'t have to pay any more). TIP: first buy a Mobilis Card and then connect your Valenbisi subscription to it.

The universiy's surrounding areas are the perfect area for Students to live in shared flats. (Avinguda Blasco Ibañez, Avinguda Ramón LLull, Plaza Honduras, plaza del Cedro, etc…). It's well connected to the rest of the city with all the necessary services (supermarkets, cafés, shops, pubs, etc). 
Another student area is the Benimaclet neighbourhood, also close to the universities and generally cheaper flats which are slightly older. It's well connected to the city with the tram line.
Another area where students decide to live is near the beach in the Cabanyal neighbourhood. This is close to the university campuses but in winter there's not as much to do. If you are coming to Valencia for the February-July period then living here has many advantages given that it's close to the beach and is where most people spend their free time; there are also lots of parties in this area in the summer.
 
The best thing to do is find a flat or a room before you arrive in the city. But don't worry, you can easily find a flat in the first two weeks you arrive in Valencia. 
Always take into account where you will be studying.
